comments: Phase 1 pilot authorizations have one year from authorization to fully address this policy but must demonstrate continuous quarterly progress.
Phase 2 Pilot participants must demonstrate significant progress towards addressing this policy prior to submission for authorization review.

releases.description: No effective/material changes; adjusted some KSI-AFR indcators to reference "process" instead of "standard" and added a note to KSI-AFR-02 addressing the potential infinite loop.
No material changes to content; updated JSON structure with additional information about Rev5 application added.

Updates Key Security Indicators for the FedRAMP 20x Phase Two pilot, including underlying structural changes to machine-readable docs; Renamed KSI "indicator" property to "theme" and KSI "requirements" property to "indicators" to match current naming conventions..

related_rfcs.full_name: FedRAMP RFC-0015: Recommended Secure Configuration Standard

releases.description: Minor updates to improve clarity; switch from federal information to federal customer data; add impact level metadata; no substantive changes.
Minor non-breaking updates to align term definitions and highlighted terms across updated materials (no changes to KSIs, definitions are now in FRD-ALL).
Key Security Indicators in this release are unchanged from previously releases. 25.05C adds references for each KSI to underlying SP 800-53 controls.

Initial release of Key Security Indicators from 25.05; the previous 25.05A release contained errors during conversion to JSON that are fixed in this release, the KSIs should now be identical to the original 25.05 paper release of the KSIs released on 2025-05-30. FRR-KSI-AY rules were converted to FRR-KSI rules, but otherwise unchanged.
Initial release of Key Security Indicators

related_rfcs.full_name: FedRAMP RFC-0006: 20x Phase One Key Security Indicators

authority.description: Appendix I states "Agencies may also develop overlays for specific types of information or communities of interest (e.g., all web-based applications, all health care-related systems) as part of the security control selection process. Overlays provide a specification of security or privacy controls, control enhancements, supplemental guidance, and other supporting information as part of the tailoring process, that is intended to complement (and further refine) security control baselines. The overlay may be more stringent or less stringent than the original security control baseline and can be applied to multiple information systems."

Section 2.5 states "As the number of controls in [SP 800-53] grows in response to an increasingly sophisticated threat space, it is important for organizations to have the ability to describe key capabilities needed to protect organizational missions and business functions, and to subsequently select controls that—if properly designed, developed, and implemented—produce such capabilities. The use of capabilities simplifies how the protection problem is viewed conceptually. Using the construct of a capability provides a method of grouping controls that are employed for a common purpose or to achieve a common objective." This section later states "Ultimately, authorization decisions (i.e., risk acceptance decisions) are made based on the degree to which the desired capabilities have been effectively achieved."

Section 3.5 states "When organizations employ the concept of capabilities, automated and manual assessments account for all security and privacy controls that comprise the security and privacy capabilities. Assessors are aware of how the controls work together to provide such capabilities."

requires that the Administrator of the General Services Administration shall "in consultation with the [DHS] Secretary, develop, coordinate, and implement a process to support agency review, reuse, and standardization, where appropriate, of security assessments of cloud computing products and services..." 44 USC § 3609 (c) (2) further states that "the [GSA] Administrator shall establish a means for the automation of security assessments and reviews."
authority.delegation: These responsibilities are delegated to the FedRAMP Director

front_matter.purpose: Modern cloud services use automated or code-driven configuration management and control planes to ensure predictable, repeatable, reliable, and secure outcomes during deployment and operation. The majority of a service security assessment can take place continuously via automated validation for simple cloud-native services if the need for a traditional control-by-control narrative approach is removed.
expected_outcomes: Cloud service providers following commercial security best practices will be able to meet and validate FedRAMP security requirements with the application of simple changes and automated capabilities
Third-party independent assessors will have a simpler framework to assess security and implementation decisions based on engineering decisions in context

Federal agencies will be able to easily, quickly, and effectively review and consume security information about the service to make informed risk-based authorization to operate decisions based on their planned use case

base.application: These requirements apply ALWAYS to ALL FedRAMP 20x authorizations based on the Effective Date(s) and Overall Applicability.
base.name: Requirements & Recommendations

requirements.statement: Cloud service providers SHOULD apply ALL Key Security Indicators to ALL aspects of their _cloud service offering_ that are within the FedRAMP Minimum Assessment Scope.
requirements.name: Application of Key Security Indicators

requirements.statement: Providers MUST maintain simple high-level summaries of at least the following for each Key Security Indicator:
following_information: Goals for how it will be implemented and validated, including clear pass/fail criteria and traceability
The consolidated _information resources_ that will be validated (this should include consolidated summaries such as "all employees with privileged access that are members of the Admin group")
The machine-based processes for validation and the _persistent_ cycle on which they will be performed (or an explanation of why this doesn't apply)
The non-machine-based processes for validation and the _persistent_ cycle on which they will be performed (or an explanation of why this doesn't apply)
Any clarifications or responses to the assessment summary
requirements.name: Implementation Summaries

AFR.name: Authorization by FedRAMP
AFR.theme: A secure cloud service provider seeking FedRAMP authorization will address all FedRAMP 20x requirements and recommendations, including government-specific requirements for maintaining a secure system and reporting on activities to government customers.

indicators.name: Minimum Assessment Scope
indicators.statement: Apply the FedRAMP Minimum Assessment Scope (MAS) to identify and document the scope of the cloud service offering to be assessed for FedRAMP authorization and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.

indicators.name: Key Security Indicators
indicators.statement: Set security goals for the cloud service offering based on FedRAMP 20x Phase Two Key Security Indicators (KSIs - you are here), develop automated validation of status and progress to the greatest extent possible, and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.
indicators.note: This KSI is not intended to create an infinite loop; unlike other KSI-AFR themed indicators, this KSI is addressed by otherwise addressing all the KSIs. Providers and assessors may use this KSI to summarize the approach, coverage, status, etc. but are not expected to include all KSIs within this KSI in an infinite loop.

indicators.name: Authorization Data Sharing
indicators.statement: Determine how authorization data will be shared with all necessary parties in alignment with the FedRAMP Authorization Data Sharing (ADS) process and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.

controls.title: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting

indicators.name: Vulnerability Detection and Response
indicators.statement: Document the vulnerability detection and vulnerability response methodology used within the cloud service offering in alignment with the FedRAMP Vulnerability Detection and Response (VDR) process and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.

controls.title: Automated Tracking, Data Collection, and Analysis
Automated Detection and Notification of Unauthorized Components
Automated Tools and Mechanisms for Real-time Analysis

indicators.name: Significant Change Notifications
indicators.statement: Determine how significant changes will be tracked and how all necessary parties will be notified in alignment with the FedRAMP Significant Change Notifications (SCN) process and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.

controls.title: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures

indicators.name: Collaborative Continuous Monitoring
indicators.statement: Maintain a plan and process for providing Ongoing Authorization Reports and Quarterly Reviews for all necessary parties in alignment with the FedRAMP Collaborative Continuous Monitoring (CCM) process and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.

indicators.name: Recommended Secure Configuration
indicators.statement: Develop secure by default configurations and provide guidance for secure configuration of the cloud service offering to customers in alignment with the FedRAMP Recommended Secure Configuration (RSC) guidance process and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.

indicators.name: FedRAMP Security Inbox
indicators.statement: Operate a secure inbox to receive critical communication from FedRAMP and other government entities in alignment with FedRAMP Security Inbox (FSI) requirements and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.

indicators.name: Persistent Validation and Assessment
indicators.statement: Persistently validate, assess, and report on the effectiveness and status of security decisions and policies that are implemented within the cloud service offering in alignment with the FedRAMP 20x Persistent Validation and Assessment (PVA) process, and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.

indicators.name: Incident Communications Procedures
indicators.statement: Integrate FedRAMP's Incident Communications Procedures (ICP) into incident response procedures and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.

indicators.name: Using Cryptographic Modules
indicators.statement: Ensure that cryptographic modules used to protect potentially sensitive federal customer data are selected and used in alignment with the FedRAMP 20x Using Cryptographic Modules (UCM) guidance and persistently address all related requirements and recommendations.

CED.name: Cybersecurity Education
CED.theme: A secure cloud service provider will continuously educate their employees on cybersecurity measures, testing them _regularly_ to ensure their knowledge is satisfactory.

indicators.name: General Education
indicators.statement: Require and monitor the effectiveness of training given to all employees on policies, procedures, and security-related topics.

indicators.name: Role-Specific Education
indicators.statement: Require and monitor the effectiveness of role-specific training for high risk roles, including at least roles with privileged access.

indicators.name: Development and Engineering Education
indicators.statement: Require and monitor the effectiveness of role-specific training provided to development and engineering staff that covers best practices for delivering secure software.

indicators.name: Incident Response and Disaster Recovery Education
indicators.statement: Require and monitor the effectiveness of role-specific training to staff involved with incident response or disaster recovery.

CMT.name: Change Management
CMT.theme: A secure cloud service provider will ensure that all system changes are properly documented and configuration baselines are updated accordingly.

indicators.name: Log and Monitor Changes
indicators.statement: Log and monitor modifications to the cloud service offering.

controls.title: Testing, Validation, and Documentation of Changes

indicators.name: Redeployment
indicators.statement: Execute changes though redeployment of version controlled immutable resources rather than direct modification wherever possible

indicators.name: Automated Testing and Validation
indicators.statement: Automate persistent testing and validation of changes throughout deployment.

controls.title: Testing, Validation, and Documentation of Changes

indicators.name: Change Management Procedure
indicators.statement: Always follow a documented change management procedure.

controls.title: Testing, Validation, and Documentation of Changes

CNA.name: Cloud Native Architecture
CNA.theme: A secure _cloud service offering_ will use cloud native architecture and design principles to enforce and enhance the Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability of the system.

indicators.name: Restrict Network Traffic
indicators.statement: Configure all machine-based information resources to limit inbound and outbound network traffic.

controls.title: Deny by Default — Allow by Exception

indicators.name: Minimize the Attack Surface
indicators.statement: Design systems to minimize the attack surface and minimize lateral movement if compromised.

controls.title: Deny by Default — Allow by Exception
Route Traffic to Authenticated Proxy Servers

indicators.name: Enforce Traffic Flow
indicators.statement: Use logical networking and related capabilities to enforce traffic flow controls.

indicators.name: Immutable Infrastructure
indicators.statement: Use immutable infrastructure with strictly defined functionality and privileges by default.

indicators.name: Unwanted Activity
indicators.statement: Protect against denial of service attacks and other unwanted activity.

indicators.name: High Availability
indicators.statement: Design systems for high availability and rapid recovery.

indicators.name: Best Practices
indicators.statement: Ensure cloud-native _information resources_ are implemented based on host provider's best practices and documented guidance.

indicators.name: Persistent Assessment and Automated Enforcement
indicators.statement: Use automated services to persistently assess the security posture of all machine-based information resources and automatically enforce their intended operational state.

IAM.name: Identity and Access Management
IAM.theme: A secure _cloud service offering_ will protect user data, control access, and apply zero trust principles.

indicators.name: Phishing-Resistant MFA
indicators.statement: Enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) using methods that are difficult to intercept or impersonate (phishing-resistant MFA) for all user authentication.

indicators.name: Passwordless Authentication
indicators.statement: Use secure passwordless methods for user authentication and authorization when feasible, otherwise enforce strong passwords with MFA.

indicators.name: Non-User Accounts
indicators.statement: Enforce appropriately secure authentication methods for non-user accounts and services.

controls.title: Automated Temporary and Emergency Account Management

indicators.name: Just-in-Time Authorization
indicators.statement: Use a least-privileged, role and attribute-based, and just-in-time security authorization model for all user and non-user accounts and services.

controls.title: Automated Temporary and Emergency Account Management
Prohibit Non-privileged Users from Executing Privileged Functions
Access by Subset of Privileged Users
Separation of System and User Functionality

indicators.name: Least Privilege
indicators.statement: Configure identity and access management with measures that always verify each user or device can only access the resources they need.

controls.title: Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authentication
Protection of Confidentiality and Integrity Using Encryption
Configure Systems and Components for High-risk Areas
Secure Name/Address Resolution Service (Recursive or Caching Resolver)
Architecture and Provisioning for Name/Address Resolution Service

indicators.name: Suspicious Activity
indicators.statement: Automatically disable or otherwise secure accounts with privileged access in response to suspicious activity

indicators.name: Automated Account Management
indicators.statement: Securely manage the lifecycle and privileges of all accounts, roles, and groups, using automation.

controls.title: Automated Temporary and Emergency Account Management

INR.name: Incident Response
INR.theme: A secure _cloud service offering_ will document, report, and analyze security incidents to ensure regulatory compliance and continuous security improvement.

indicators.name: Incident Response Procedure
indicators.statement: Always follow a documented incident response procedure.

controls.title: Automation Support for Availability of Information and Support

indicators.name: Incident Logging
indicators.statement: Maintain a log of incidents and periodically review past incidents for patterns or vulnerabilities.

indicators.name: Incident After Action Reports
indicators.statement: Generate after action reports and _regularly_ incorporate lessons learned into operations.

MLA.name: Monitoring, Logging, and Auditing
MLA.theme: A secure _cloud service offering_ will monitor, log, and audit all important events, activity, and changes.

indicators.name: Security Information and Event Management (SIEM)
indicators.statement: Operate a Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) or similar system(s) for centralized, tamper-resistent logging of events, activities, and changes.

controls.title: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures
Audit Record Reduction and Report Generation
Automated Tools and Mechanisms for Real-time Analysis

indicators.name: Audit Logging
indicators.statement: _Regularly_ review and audit logs.

controls.title: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting

indicators.name: Infrastructure as Code
indicators.statement: Perform Infrastructure as Code and configuration evaluation and testing.

indicators.name: Event Types
indicators.statement: Maintain a list of information resources and event types that will be monitored, logged, and audited, then do so.

indicators.name: Log Data Access
indicators.statement: Use a least-privileged, role and attribute-based, and just-in-time access authorization model for access to log data based on organizationally defined data sensitivity.

PIY.name: Policy and Inventory
PIY.theme: A secure _cloud service offering_ will have intentional, organized, universal guidance for how every _information resource_, including personnel, is secured.

indicators.name: Automated Inventory
indicators.statement: Use authoritative sources to automatically maintain real-time inventories of all information resources.

controls.title: Automation Support for Accuracy and Currency
Automated Tools to Support Information Location

indicators.name: Security Objectives and Requirements
indicators.statement: Document the security objectives and requirements for each information resource or set of information resources.

controls.title: Social Media and External Site/Application Usage Restrictions

indicators.name: Vulnerability Disclosure Program
indicators.statement: Maintain a vulnerability disclosure program.

indicators.name: CISA Secure By Design
indicators.statement: Monitor the effectiveness of building security and privacy considerations into the Software Development Lifecycle and aligning with CISA Secure By Design principles.

indicators.name: Evaluate Implementations
indicators.statement: Document methods used to evaluate _information resource_ implementations.

indicators.name: Security Investment Effectiveness
indicators.statement: Monitor the effectiveness of the organization's investments in achieving security objectives.

indicators.name: Supply Chain Risk Management
indicators.statement: Document risk management decisions for software supply chain security.

indicators.name: Executive Support
indicators.statement: Regularly measure executive support for achieving the organization’s security objectives.

RPL.name: Recovery Planning
RPL.theme: A secure _cloud service offering_ will define, maintain, and test incident response plan(s) and recovery capabilities to ensure minimal service disruption and data loss during incidents and contingencies.

indicators.name: Recovery Objectives
indicators.statement: Define Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPO).

indicators.name: Recovery Plan
indicators.statement: Develop and maintain a recovery plan that aligns with the defined recovery objectives.

indicators.name: System Backups
indicators.statement: Perform system backups aligned with recovery objectives.

indicators.name: Recovery Testing
indicators.statement: _Regularly_ test the capability to recover from incidents and contingencies.

SVC.name: Service Configuration
SVC.theme: A secure _cloud service offering_ will follow FedRAMP encryption policies, continuously verify _information resource_ integrity, and restrict access to _third-party information resources_.

indicators.name: Continuous Improvement
indicators.statement: Implement improvements based on persistent evaluation of information resources for opportunities to improve security.

controls.title: Automated Tools to Support Information Location

indicators.name: Network Encryption
indicators.statement: Encrypt or otherwise secure network traffic.

controls.title: Protection of Confidentiality and Integrity Using Encryption
Secure Name/Address Resolution Service (Recursive or Caching Resolver)
Architecture and Provisioning for Name/Address Resolution Service

indicators.name: Configuration Automation
indicators.statement: Manage configuration of machine-based information resources using automation.

controls.title: Automation Support for Accuracy and Currency

indicators.name: Resource Integrity
indicators.statement: Use cryptographic methods to validate the integrity of machine-based information resources.

controls.title: Automation Support for Accuracy and Currency

indicators.name: Secret Management
indicators.statement: Automate management, protection, and regular rotation of digital keys, certificates, and other secrets.

controls.title: Protection of Confidentiality and Integrity Using Encryption

indicators.name: Patching
indicators.statement: Use a consistent, risk-informed approach for applying security patches.

indicators.name: Shared Resources
indicators.statement: Do not introduce or leave behind residual elements that could negatively affect confidentiality, integrity, or availability of _federal customer data_ during operations.

indicators.name: Communication Integrity
indicators.statement: Persistently validate the authenticity and integrity of communications between _machine-based_ _information resources_ using automation.

indicators.name: Data Destruction
indicators.statement: Remove unwanted federal customer data promptly when requested by an agency in alignment with customer agreements, including from backups if appropriate; this typically applies when a customer spills information or when a customer seeks to remove information from a service due to a change in usage.

TPR.name: Third-Party Information Resources
TPR.theme: A secure _cloud service offering_ will understand, monitor, and manage supply chain risks from _third-party information resources_.

indicators.name: Supply Chain Risk Management
indicators.statement: Identify and prioritize mitigation of potential supply chain risks.

indicators.name: Supply Chain Risk Monitoring
indicators.statement: Automatically monitor third party software _information resources_ for upstream vulnerabilities using mechanisms that may include contractual notification requirements or active monitoring services.
